content:
Multi-Omics Gene-Trait Association Analysis

Integrative Meta-Analysis for Complex Trait Studies

The nf-core/omicsgenetraitassociation pipeline performs sophisticated meta-analysis of trait associations, accounting for correlations across omics studies arising from hidden non-independencies between study elements, such as overlapping or related samples.

Pipeline Overview

This pipeline integrates multiple omic association data streams to perform coordinated analysis and uncover complex gene-trait relationships that may be missed by single-source studies.

Key Features

  • Gene-level Aggregation: Uses PASCAL to aggregate GWAS summary statistics at the gene level

  • Multi-Source Integration: Combines GWAS, TWAS, and additional omic association data

  • Correlated Meta-Analysis: Performs meta-analysis using corrmeta, accounting for sample overlap and relatedness

  • Module Enrichment: Identifies enriched biological modules and pathways

  • GO Enrichment: Comprehensive gene ontology enrichment analysis

  • Multiple Traits: Supports analysis of multiple traits simultaneously

Workflow Steps

  1. PASCAL: Aggregate GWAS summary statistics at gene level

  2. MMAP: Perform gene-trait associations with transcriptome-wide association

  3. corrmeta: Conduct correlated meta-analysis accounting for sample overlap

  4. Enrichment Analysis: Identify enriched modules and gene ontology terms

Input Requirements

The pipeline requires a CSV samplesheet with the following structure:

sample,trait,pascal,twas,additional_sources
study1,height,gwas_summary.csv.gz,twas_results.csv,other_omics.csv
study2,bmi,gwas_summary2.csv.gz,twas_results2.csv,

Column Descriptions

  • sample: Custom sample/study identifier

  • trait: Trait name being analyzed

  • pascal: Path to GWAS summary statistics (CSV or CSV.gz format)

  • twas: Path to transcriptome-wide association study phenotype file (CSV format)

  • additional_sources: Optional path to additional omic association p-values

Use Cases

  • Complex Trait Analysis: Integrate multiple evidence sources for height, BMI, disease risk

  • Cross-Study Meta-Analysis: Combine results from related studies with overlapping samples

  • Multi-Omic Integration: Leverage genomics, transcriptomics, and other omics layers

  • Pathway Discovery: Identify biological pathways and modules associated with traits

  • Biomarker Identification: Discover gene-trait associations across multiple evidence types

Output

The pipeline generates comprehensive results including:

  • Gene-level Statistics: Aggregated gene-trait association scores

  • Meta-Analysis Results: Combined evidence across studies with correlation adjustment

  • Enrichment Reports: Module and GO enrichment analysis results

  • QC Reports: Quality control metrics and diagnostic plots

  • Interactive Visualizations: Publication-ready figures and tables

Resource Requirements

This pipeline can be computationally intensive depending on the number of traits and studies. Choose an appropriate resource configuration:

  • Medium (32 CPUs, 180GB RAM): Small to medium studies, single traits

  • Large (64 CPUs, 360GB RAM): Recommended for most analyses, multiple traits

  • XLarge (96 CPUs, 540GB RAM): Large-scale studies, many traits and samples

Perfect for Research in: Complex trait genetics • GWAS meta-analysis • Multi-omics integration • Systems genetics • Precision medicine • Biomarker discovery • Drug target identification
